Description: Lamp for a stand; bronze; in the shape of a peacock, with circular foot; the spout is at the end of the tail, and the hole for filling in the back is covered by a hinged leaf-shaped lid.
Curator's comments: Parallels: M. C. Ross, Catalogue of the Byzantine and Early Medieval Antiquities in the Dumbarton Oaks Collection, vol. 1 (Washington DC 1962) cat. 41 (inv. 40.21); S. D. Campbell (ed.), The Malcove Collection (Toronto 1985) cat. 47 (inv. M82.398).
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (509)
Buckton 1994 / Byzantium: Treasures of Byzantine art and culture from British collections (120)
Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3605MLA)
Xanthopoulou 2010 / Les lampes en bronze à l’époque paléochrétienne (LA 15.046)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989 23 Jun-31 Aug, Durham Cathedral, Anglo Saxon Connections
Acquisition name: Purchased from: George Cadogan, 3rd Earl Cadogan (Sale)
